block.p: Marcy Beth Sharkey, a daughter of Betty Sharkey and Dr. Irwin Sharkey of New York, was married last evening to Michael Leon Farkas, the son of Diana Farkas and Lt. Col. Robert N. Farkas of New York. Rabbi Robert N. Levine officiated at the Inwood Country Club in Inwood, N.Y.

Mrs. Farkas, 27, graduated from New York University. Her father, an internist, practices in New York and is an associate clinical professor at the New York University School of Medicine. He was until 1991 the chief of medicine at New York Infirmary-Beekman Downtown Hospital. Her mother is a partner in Focus on Interiors, a design business in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Marcy Beth Sharkey, a daughter of Betty Sharkey and Dr. Irwin Sharkey of New York, was married last evening to Michael Leon Farkas, the son of Diana Farkas and Lt. Col. Robert N. Farkas of New York. Rabbi Robert N. Levine officiated at the Inwood Country Club in Inwood, N.Y.

Mrs. Farkas, 27, graduated from New York University. Her father, an internist, practices in New York and is an associate clinical professor at the New York University School of Medicine. He was until 1991 the chief of medicine at New York Infirmary-Beekman Downtown Hospital. Her mother is a partner in Focus on Interiors, a design business in New Rochelle, N.Y.

Mr. Farkas, 31, is the assistant to the president at Company Management, a modeling agency, and at Flutie Media, a fashion and entertainment public relations agency. The bridegroom graduated from Hunter College. His mother, a real estate broker, is the senior vice president and a broker at Deborah Fredericks Enterprises, a residential real estate agency in New York. His father retired from the 77th Army Reserve Command in New York and is now an account executive in New York with Silicon Graphics, the computer company.
